Writer

Writer#

class writer.Writer[source]#

Handle text and signature insertion in PDF forms using PyMuPDF.

fill_document(extracted_data, to_sign=False, save_it=False)[source]#

Fill a given PDF document with extracted user data.

Parameters:

  • doc (Document) – The PDF document to be modified.

  • extracted_data (ExtractedData) – A dictionary containing structured extracted data. Expected format: - ‘page_0’: Contains user information under ‘user_infos’ - ‘page_X’: Contains relevant data for each page (e.g., tax details)

  • to_sign (bool, optional) – If True, inserts a signature on the final page.

  • False. (Defaults to)

  • save_it (bool, optional) – If True, save the filled document into the output

  • folder.

Returns:

The modified PDF document with the filled-in data.

Return type:

Document

fill_empty_table_first_page(page)[source]#

Fill an empty cell in the tax table on the first page.

Parameters:

page (Page) – The PDF page containing the tax table.

Returns:

The modified page with the filled cell.

Return type:

Page

fill_empty_table_second_page(page)[source]#

Fill empty cells in the tax table on the second page.

Args: page (Page): The PDF page containing the tax table.

Returns:

The modified page with the filled cells.

Return type:

Page

fill_final_box(page, user_name, location='Brussels', date_format='%d-%m-%Y', insert_signature=None)[source]#

Fill predefined placeholders in the final form with user details.

Parameters:

  • page (Page) – The PDF page to modify.

  • user_name (str) – The name of the user to insert.

  • location (str, optional) – The location to insert. Defaults to “Brussels”.

  • date_format (str, optional) – The date format. Defaults to “%d-%m-%Y”.

  • insert_signature (bool | None, optional) – Whether to insert a signature.

  • None. (Defaults to)

Returns:

The modified PDF page with the inserted details.

Return type:

Page

fill_first_box(page, user_data)[source]#

Populate the first section of a form page with personal user information.

Parameters:

  • page (Page) – The page pdf to fill.

  • user_data (dict[str, str]) – User information containing:

  • date (-) – String in format ‘DD.MM.YYYY’

  • national_number (-) – National identification number

  • full_name (-) – User’s complete name

  • address (-) – Street address

  • postal_code (-) – Zip/postal code

Returns:

Modified page object with inserted text, enabling method chaining.

Return type:

Page

fill_tax_table(page, pages_data)[source]#

Populate tax table entries and calculates total tax amount for the tax table document.

Parameters:

  • page (Page) – PDF page object containing the tax table.

  • pages_data (dict[str, dict[str, dict[str, str]]]) – Structured transaction data

  • with –

    • First-level keys: ‘page_1’, ‘page_2’, etc.

    • Each page contains:

      • ’rate’: Tax rate category (e.g., ‘0.12%’, ‘1.32%_upper’)

      • ’summary’: Financial summary containing:

        ’TOTAL_TAX_BASIS_IN_EUR’: Taxable base amount ‘TOTAL_TAX_AMOUNT_IN_EUR’: Calculated tax amount ‘TOTAL_TRANSACTIONS’: Number of transactions

Returns:

Modified page object with populated tax table values.

Return type:

Page

fill_total_tax_amount(page, total_tax_amount)[source]#

Insert the final total tax amount into the designated tax table location.

Parameters:

  • page (Page) – PDF page object containing the tax table.

  • total_tax_amount (float) – Accumulated sum of all tax amounts from

  • value. (individual transactions. Should be a positive numeric)

Returns:

Modified page object with total tax amount inserted.

Return type:

Page
